comment: He provides the material for you to gain a good understanding of basic personal finance. However, the material he does offer is old and unorganized. On top of that, the online assignments and quizzes make this class an easy A. Be prepared to show up and pass or work hard to learn to get the same grade, the choice is yours lol

First, the below review is somewhat true. Yes, he can be mean, but that shouldn't keep you from taking this guy. The material isn't that hard if you just go through the PPT slides and the solutions to HW he posts. He posts helpful study guides. You're just graded on tests and HW, which I liked. Honestly, if you just put in some effort you can an A.

**THIS IS FOR COVID 19 ERA** I am currently in his class which turned to online due to COVID 19. Not sure how this professor has a job. He does not respect his students at all. Emailed him a question about the homework and he replied that he was disappointed since I am a Finance major. Tests and Hw only; Good luck but I would beware.

Not sure why so many bad reviews. This class is a piece of cake, especially if you are a visual learner. He provides notes every class and tells you specifically what will be tested. And almost every week provides extra credit opportunities. I will more than likely be getting an A this semester and I've already signed up for his 4460 class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hybrid class and there was nothing online to do. We had 3 exams (math problems opened notes and concepts were closed notes) both in class. The concepts are much harder then expected. soft spoken and does not really answer questions. Over all it is a class where you can make an A OR B if you put in some effort and do the advance credit *

He's not a very good professor, but he gives you everything you need to do well on his exams. Open note exams BUT his quizzes are hard, and they're strictly timed. He allows two attempts BUT takes the average of both scores which doesn't help too much. I made all A's on his exams and his quizzes are keeping me at a very low A.

Not sure what happened to this guy. He gave us previous semesters tests as study material, but our tests were much harder than those. And what extra credit is everyone on here talking about? He gave us one extra credit opportunity at the beginning of the semester, none after that. He's not helpful at all, quite rude actually. Didn't like him.

This professor does not like to answer questions. He will tell you to use google for material not covered and yet required for class. He refuses to discuss prior quiz questions for clarification. Do NOT take him. He goes on my list of the worst professors I have experienced at KSU.

He's the worst professor I've ever had. His class is all over the place, there's no structure, and the tests are full of vague information. He was incredibly rude to me if I asked a question, and all the students I talked to shared my sentiments. The quizzes were ridiculously hard, the class average was a D. Please STAY AWAY from him!
Very easy course.. Listen to him while he teaches, do the extra credit, and read over the study guides and you will make an easy A.  Only used the textbook for the online quizzes.

Class based on 3 exams, few quizzes, and many extra credit opportunities. The quizzes are not hard if you follow up with the study guides. I learned a lot in this class. I also took him for FIN 4420 which the class structure is the same as FIN 4460 and the quizzes are much comprehensive and easier. Great professor!
Very easy class, open booknotes exams, online quizzes, and many extra credit opportunities. Probably one of the easiest A's I have ever had and I actually learned quite a lot from that class as well.

Finance is not an easy subject, but Prof. Wakeling makes it as easy as possible. There are tons of opportunities for extra credit. He wants you do well. You can schedule time in virtual office hours or on campus for assistance. Final exam is the only exam in the class, but every chapter has a quiz. Final is online.

Very easy class. Tenured professor found a system to pass most of the class with an A or a B. No textbook required. Watch out for the online quizzes, they are tricky. Don't expect much help from him, be careful asking him questions in class too. Make sure you decipher his emails correctly. You will wonder why you are paying so much $$$ for this.

Professor Wakeling was definitely helpful, he brought the hand outs to class and made sure that he gave good notes.  He used an open notes policy on the test and the quizzes were online.  The hardest part of the class was the quizzes, because they were more complexed than the problems we reviewed in class.  Overall I had a good experience.

This professor gives you EVERY opportunity to succeed. He offers A LOT of bonus opportunities and online lectures are available if you miss class! Great email communicator, but not very approachable in person. Do the bonus work and you will be golden!
I would not recommend this professor. His quizzes are poorly worded and 50% of the time i couldn't understand the question.

I took his hybrid Financial statement analysis. Fist part of the semester was dull and textbook but the second half was interesting. Tests can be a little tough but he offers plenty of chances for bonus points throughout the semester as long as you attend class. Bonus points brought me from a high B to a High A. I would recommend taking his class.

Although I took this class online, he is the WORST professor I have ever had. Not helpful, mean and I felt that he took plessure in watching me cry when I would ask for help. Avoid this professor at all costs.

Professor Wakeling is organized and provides copious amount of notes and handouts for use.  Quizzes are hard, but passable if you read.  Tests are generally okay with some closed note and some open notes.  Lectures are pretty boring and can get off-topic.  He provides plenty of extra credit opptys throughout the semester for extra credit.

Tests/quizzes are multiple choice on terms, concepts and open notes on problems.  Gives lots of problem examples that you can use on tests.  Missing a few classes won't hurt, stays true to syllabus schedule.  Put in some effort (read material, review problems before tests) for an easy A.  Optional final.

Easy online class. Didn't buy the textbook because he put all the PowerPoints and notes online. Maintained an A all semester until I failed the on campus final. Final had information that wasn't covered on previous tests which was our study guide. Class doesn't count for business majors.

I took this class in Summer. It was online. Their was a quiz for chapter. The notes were power points with his voice over on them discussing them. Then two individual and two group  assignments. The hardest part of class was final because it was in class. You have to make sure you keep up with assignments. I did learn a lot in this course
His classes are very easy. I took him for FIN 4260 and FIN 4620. Got an A+ in both. His tests are open notes and its straight forward.

Good experience with the hybrid format. Tests are curved and have 2 parts: mult choice (closed notes, tricky), and problems (open notes). One project can be done in a group or individually. Some extra credit opportunities available, and final was optional.
His class is so easy. His test are open notes and he is straight forward. easy A

I certainly took on a daunting taskthis year..taking Wakeling for Fin 4260, Fin 4420, and Fin 4620. Although he can be very dry, his classes are very straightforward. I didn't think his multiple choice was near as hard as people are saying. Study highlighted sections in notes and you'll do great. Probs open notes for all 3 classes. EASY A Take him!
Attendance mandatory and class is really boring. Tests are straight forward from notes online. Problem tests are open notes.

I have had him for two different classes now, and the format was the same.  Have lots of quizzes that have a multiple choice section (hard) and a problems section (open notes and exactly like the examples). He drops the lowest quiz and adds points for good attendance. Final is optional and cant hurt. He is somewhat boring but can easily get an A

This professor was wonderful. I was scared entering finance because it was always said to be difficult. Even as an online class I was able to easily obtain an A. Extra credit was always offered, open book/note tests. I would DEFINITELY recommend a finance calculator.
I took this class online and it was hard but he is a very good professor plus the text book is excellent. The online class takes a lot of your time so I will not be taking anymore online classes.

Took Fall online. Material is quite hard but this professor is really amazing. I have never seen a more thorough or involved online professor. If you fail this class it is your own fault because he provides you with absolutely everything that you need to do well. Grade was 100 point chapter quiz each week, plus a 40% on-campus open-notes final.

Very helpful and responds to question sometimes within minutes.  He loves talking about and teaching finance and provides tons of info regarding subject.  This was a hybrid online course and I enjoyed it.  He gives just the right amount of material to study and prepare for tests/quizzes.  Great professor!

This was the first time this course was offered, I took it online. He was very helpful. I suggest you watch his narrated lectures, they are short but very informative. A lot of the course is definitions with some group work. Quizzes every week, very easy. Final Exam on campus is basically old quiz questions without any calcualtions... very easy A!
Took this class online; The professor gives you everything you can possibly need to be successful. Pay attention to the example problems and you will do well.

Don't take the online class with  this teacher, very difficult and not very easy to comprehend. Learning material are not all to what it seems to be. Very difficult class and not a very effective professor.

This guy is awesome, extremely helpful with every aspect of the class. Sure he can be monotone but sometimes he'll crack jokes and he makes almost every other class available online if you don't want to go.  There are never tests, just chapter quizzes and lots of extra points, very easy to get an A.

I found the class quite boring, and he is very monotone.  But we used the calculator tons and learned how to do financial problems on it, which is good. All tests were take home and the final was an open book.  All and all an easy A.

Material covered by the class is very difficult, and not interesting. But optional take-home tests (as well as the book) can be used during in-class tests. If you do the take-home, the tests will be a lot easier. Just do the problems on the in-class test the same way as the take-home.
